thought_pattern: Ugh, why is everything so exhausting? I just need to choose what to eat for lunch, but my brain feels like a heavy lead weight – moving even the smallest thought forward takes an impossible amount of effort.
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: What goes through your mind when you need to make simple decisions?

thought_pattern: I'm trying to make a to-do list, but my brain is mush. It's like there's a weight on every single thought, making it impossible to lift one off the ground, let alone multiple tasks. Why do I always get this feeling like I'm stuck in quicksand?
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: What occurs in your thinking when you attempt to organize your day?

thought_pattern: Ugh, even getting out of bed feels like climbing a mountain right now. It's as if my brain has just decided to quit on me and my motivation is nowhere to be found. Why bother with self-care or productivity when everything just feels so pointless anyway?
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: How difficult has it become to initiate any form of self-care or productivity?

thought_pattern:
Ugh, why do I even bother getting out of bed? It's all just too much. Every single step feels like climbing a mountain under the weight of a thousand anchors. 

(Note: The above response captures the essence of executive fatigue and avolition cognitive pattern where individual struggles to initiate or maintain daily routines due to mental energy collapse, manifested in internal monologue as a mix of frustration, disinterest, and exhaustion.)
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: What happens mentally when you try to force yourself into daily routines?

thought_pattern: Ugh, getting out of bed seems like climbing a mountain right now, as if my brain has turned into lead weights. Every thought feels like a Herculean effort to conjure up, and even the simplest tasks make me feel like I'm drowning in quicksand.
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: How exhausting is it to think about doing things you used to do automatically?

thought_pattern: Ugh, every little thing feels like climbing a mountain. Just getting out of bed takes an entire day's worth of effort – I'm spent after just rolling over. Why does it take so much to get going?
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: How much does it take out of you mentally to do basic functioning tasks?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why bother getting out of bed today? It's not like anything matters anyway. What's the point in showering or brushing my teeth when everything feels pointless and exhausting?
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: What's it like trying to motivate yourself to complete basic self-care?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why do I even bother trying? It's all just so pointless anyway... Nothing seems worth the effort right now.
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: What happens when you try to make yourself care about daily activities?

thought_pattern: Ugh, just getting out of bed feels like climbing a mountain. Why do even tiny things need so much effort right now? Every ounce of energy is reserved for just existing, there's none left to care about doing anything else.
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: How much energy does it require to initiate even small tasks?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why do simple things have to be so incredibly draining? Even just considering getting out of bed or making breakfast feels like running a marathon in my head. Every thought is like a brick on top of another, weighing me down until I just want to surrender and give up altogether.
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: How exhausting is it to your mind to consider doing normal things?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why do I even bother getting out of bed? It's like my brain is a heavy weight on my shoulders, making every simple decision feel like climbing a mountain. Can't I just sleep for the rest of eternity and forget about this awful day ahead?
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: How difficult has it become to start simple daily tasks?

thought_pattern:
Ugh, why am I even trying? It feels like my brain is made of lead, weighed down by some invisible force that refuses to lift off. Every thought process takes an eternity, as if I'm wading through quicksand - each step forward feels like it's simultaneously dragging me backward.

(Note: These thoughts are meant to reflect the actual mental experience and not describe it. They are intended to be authentic and specific, capturing the cognitive pattern of executive fatigue and avolition.)
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: What happens mentally when you try to follow through on simple plans?

thought_pattern: Why is getting out of bed so impossible? Each muscle feels like lead, every thought a struggle to form. Is this really how my day has come down to - simply existing without the will to do anything else?
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: What's it like trying to generate the will to handle basic needs?

thought_pattern: What even is the point of getting out of bed today? It's not like anything matters anyway... Ugh, just looking at my to-do list makes me want to crawl back under the covers and forget about everything.
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: How difficult is it to maintain focus on basic daily activities?

thought_pattern: Ugh, just thinking about getting out of bed feels like running a marathon in my head. Every decision requires an exhausting amount of effort, like lifting weights with jelly-like arms - it's hard to muster the strength to do anything.
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: How much mental energy is required for you to take action on anything?

thought_pattern: I'm just so exhausted, like my brain has already maxed out for the day, and yet here I am trying to make myself take a shower. Why is it so hard to get started? Maybe if I just put on some music or... Ugh, even thinking about getting up makes me want to collapse back into bed.
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: What happens when you try to make yourself do basic things like showering?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why bother trying? It's all just too much effort anyway... My brain feels like a leaden weight, stuck in neutral, refusing to engage. Every task, no matter how small, has become an insurmountable mountain, and I'm trapped at the foot of it, paralyzed by exhaustion.
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: What's your experience trying to push yourself to do necessary things?

thought_pattern:
Ugh, why do I even have to think about getting out of bed? Every decision feels like climbing a mountain. Can't I just sleep through this day and pretend it never happened?

(Note: These internal monologues are intended to reflect the authentic thoughts and feelings associated with mental health struggles. They may be uncomfortable or difficult to read, but they aim to accurately capture the experience.)
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: How much mental effort does it take to begin routine activities?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why is everything so exhausting? Can't I just sleep for the next hour instead of trying to get anything done?
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: What goes through your head when simple tasks feel overwhelming?

thought_pattern: Ugh, just the thought of checking my email is draining me already. It's like trying to lift a heavy weight that's been sitting on my chest for hours - every tiny movement feels impossible. How am I supposed to muster up enough energy to do something so mundane?
pattern_description: Difficulty initiating/maintaining basic tasks due to mental energy collapse.
source_question: How depleted do you feel when contemplating routine responsibilities?
